metadata.description: Detailed impacted rivers, complete aqueduct routes, and infrastructure connections

flow_status_legend.seasonal: Flow only during wet season or flood releases

connection_types.dam_to_canal: Water extraction point from dam/reservoir to canal
connection_types.canal_to_city: Water delivery from canal to urban area
connection_types.dam_to_city: Direct water delivery from dam to city

properties.name: Colorado River below Hoover Dam
properties.description: Flow heavily regulated by Hoover Dam; reduced from natural levels

properties.name: Colorado River below Davis Dam
properties.description: Sequential dam regulation; significant flow reduction

properties.name: Colorado River below Parker Dam
properties.description: Major diversions to CAP and Colorado River Aqueduct; 50% flow reduction

properties.name: Colorado River below Imperial Dam
properties.description: All-American Canal diversion; seasonal flow

properties.name: Colorado River Delta
properties.description: River rarely reaches ocean; delta ecosystem severely impacted

properties.name: Salt River below Roosevelt Dam
properties.description: River runs completely dry; all water diverted to Phoenix metro

properties.name: Gila River lower reach
properties.description: Ephemeral flow; seasonal water only

properties.name: Rio Grande below Elephant Butte Dam
properties.description: Often runs dry in summer; irrigation withdrawal exceeds inflow

properties.name: Central Arizona Project (CAP) - Main Canal
properties.description: 336-mile canal bringing Colorado River water to Phoenix and Tucson

properties.name: Colorado River Aqueduct (CRA)
properties.destination: Los Angeles, San Diego, Southern California
properties.description: 242-mile aqueduct supplying Southern California

properties.name: All-American Canal
properties.description: 82-mile canal serving Imperial Valley

properties.name: Parker Dam to CAP Intake
properties.description: Connection point: Colorado River water enters CAP

properties.name: CAP to Phoenix
properties.description: CAP water delivery to Phoenix metro

properties.name: CAP to Tucson
properties.description: CAP water delivery to Tucson

properties.name: Parker Dam to CRA Intake
properties.description: Connection point: Colorado River water enters CRA

properties.name: Imperial Dam to All-American Canal
properties.description: Connection point: Colorado River water enters All-American Canal

properties.name: Roosevelt Dam to Phoenix (SRP)
properties.description: Salt River Project water delivery to Phoenix

properties.name: California Aqueduct (State Water Project)
properties.description: 444-mile aqueduct serving 27 million people; world's highest single-lift pump

properties.name: Los Angeles Aqueduct
properties.description: 233-mile gravity-flow aqueduct from Eastern Sierra; built 1913

properties.name: Hetch Hetchy Aqueduct
properties.description: 167-mile aqueduct serving 2.7 million in SF Bay Area

properties.name: Mokelumne Aqueduct
properties.description: 91-mile aqueduct serving 1.4 million in East Bay

properties.name: Delaware Aqueduct
properties.description: 85-mile tunnel - world's longest; supplies 50% of NYC water

properties.name: Catskill Aqueduct
properties.description: 92-mile aqueduct; with Delaware provides 90% of NYC water

properties.name: Trinity River Canal (Dallas)
properties.description: Water supply system for 7+ million in DFW area

properties.name: Colorado River Pipeline (Austin)
properties.description: Pipeline system serving Austin metro from Highland Lakes

properties.name: Salt River Project Canals
properties.description: 131 miles of canals serving Phoenix metro; oldest US reclamation project

properties.name: Southern Nevada Water System
properties.description: Intake system serving 2.2 million; 90% of Vegas water from Colorado

properties.name: Denver Water System (Moffat Tunnel)
properties.description: Transmountain diversion through Continental Divide
